content:
Hola lovelies :purple_heart: :unicorn: -
I wonder if there is any use/value for me to send PR's to add some error'ing around / removal of unwrap()'ing or adding at least bug panic message unwrap_or_else's?
I just went down a rabbithole to investigate historical problem from a year ago between cargo as a dependency between 0.41.0 and 0.43.0 where when someone was using Git url's on their manifest they got errors due to changing Err() behaviour by url::Url on which unwrap() panic'd
https://github.com/rust-secure-code/cargo-geiger/issues/83#issuecomment-1006431479
It seems to me that that toml/manifest/metadata stuff was intended as internal but it's been used by several libs that got affected it - including cargo-geiger and tarpaulin I found associated issues on.
thx.

This gave me an idea to static analysis the ecosystem around references between potential Err()'s and Unwrap()'s between consumer/lib dep and weigh based on amount of reference's the criticality whilst giving crucial visibility to maintainers/devs.
It sounds interesting. what did you have in mind?
